page.title: 08KERSEY
page.content:
Kersey was the centre of the mediaeval wool trade,and gave its name to the woolen material known as Kersey cloth or "Kerseys". In the fourteenth century there were sheep everywhere around the village. There was a rise in wool prices and beause the people produced far more wool than they needed,the extra fleeces were sold abroad. The spinners and weavers of Kersey became very wealthy.
Aldham Mill was once used as a water Mill.The water wheel was at the back and still is. The river at the back is called the River Brett.
